title: Task Management Application Playbook
summary: A playbook for building a modern task management web application that allows teams to collaborate on projects.

phases.name: Phase 1: Planning and Design
phases.description: Define project requirements, design architecture, create wireframes, and develop a minimum viable product (MVP) plan.
steps: Research user needs and pain points
Design the app's structure and components
Create wireframes for each page
Develop MVP plan with timeline, milestones, and dependencies

phases.name: Phase 2: Development
phases.description: Implement user authentication using OAuth (Google, GitHub), implement real-time updates when team members make changes, create a Kanban board view with drag-and-drop functionality.
steps: Design and develop the app's backend architecture
Integrate Google/GitHub OAuth for user authentication
Implement real-time updates using WebSockets or Serverless Functions
Create a Kanban board view with drag-and-drop functionality
Develop file attachments, comments, and task labels

phases.name: Phase 3: Testing
phases.description: Test the app's functionality thoroughly to ensure it meets requirements.
steps: Create a test plan with specific tests for each requirement
Run automated and manual testing on MVP
Update the MVP based on feedback from testers
Perform A/B testing if necessary

phases.name: Phase 4: Deployment and Maintenance
phases.description: Deploy the app to a production environment, set up monitoring tools for performance and security.
steps: Set up continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline
Deploy the MVP to a production environment
Configure monitoring tools for performance and security
Update the app regularly based on user feedback, new requirements, or changes in technology

phases.name: Phase 5: Marketing and Outreach
phases.description: Promote the app to target audience through various channels.
steps: Create a marketing plan with specific strategies for each channel
Outreach to potential users, partners, and investors
Analyze user feedback and usage data to improve the app's functionality and design
Update the MVP based on user feedback, new requirements, or changes in technology

considerations: Consider using a framework like React/Redux for frontend development
Consider using Node.js as the backend language and Express for routing and middleware
success_criteria: App is accessible on mobile devices with a responsive design
Team members can collaborate effectively and efficiently using the app
App has a smooth onboarding process for new users
App provides real-time updates when team members make changes
App allows teams to manage tasks, deadlines, priorities, and labels
App integrates with popular file storage services like Google Drive or Dropbox

roles.name: UX Designer
responsibilities: Designing the app's layout, color scheme, and typography
